Sentencas: Rapid oxygen ion conduction, which is important in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrolytes, is often dramatically hindered by the presence of even small concentrations of impurities such as SiO2, which is ubiquitous in ceramic processing.
Titulo: Improving SiO2 impurity tolerance of Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9: Synergy of CaO and ZnO in scavenging grain-boundary resistive phases

Sentencas: In this study, rapid degradation of the grain boundary (GB) conduction of Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 (SDC) is observed with increasing SiO2 addition from 0 to 1 wt%.
Titulo: Improving SiO2 impurity tolerance of Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9: Synergy of CaO and ZnO in scavenging grain-boundary resistive phases

Sentencas: Nearly complete GB conduction recovery is achieved through synergy between CaO and ZnO in the SDC + x wt% Si systems.
Titulo: Improving SiO2 impurity tolerance of Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9: Synergy of CaO and ZnO in scavenging grain-boundary resistive phases

Sentencas: Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) combined with energy dispersive spectroscopy (EDS) demonstrate the formation of a Ca-, Si-, and Sm-containing secondary phases, which is related to the enhancements in GB conductivity and reductions in activation energy.
Titulo: Improving SiO2 impurity tolerance of Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9: Synergy of CaO and ZnO in scavenging grain-boundary resistive phases

Sentencas: The scavenging effect of CaO is verified in this study and ZnO is observed to promote the scavenging reaction.
Titulo: Improving SiO2 impurity tolerance of Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9: Synergy of CaO and ZnO in scavenging grain-boundary resistive phases

Sentencas: Compared with the single-addition case (CaO/ZnO), the much higher SiO2 impurity tolerance of the combined system suggests the commercial potential of the scavenger + promoter strategy presented in this work.
Titulo: Improving SiO2 impurity tolerance of Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9: Synergy of CaO and ZnO in scavenging grain-boundary resistive phases
